cce377a031c971106434fc9e704d362e (08:09): hi, when adding a port on /etc/services  do I need to reboot or is there a command to ask the system to re-read /etc/services?
ca86d9dd8e95ae429b6adfd8e83ae107 (08:10): soyben: the question is why you added a port on /etc/services eh ?
cce377a031c971106434fc9e704d362e (08:10): i have an application that requieres a new port..does that make sense? it does not use any ports that currently on the list
90af48e709892633f356bb20c25c02f3 (08:11): soyben, I don't think you need to reboot
90af48e709892633f356bb20c25c02f3 (08:12): soyben, As long as the program is running, the port should be automatically opened.
cce377a031c971106434fc9e704d362e (08:12): but how do you activate the system to re-read /etc/services ? its not using that port right now upon starting my application
90af48e709892633f356bb20c25c02f3 (08:13): soyben, So... you installed a new program. Out of curiosity, what is it? (just for the sake of discussion)
cce377a031c971106434fc9e704d362e (08:13): one i created..a simple server
90af48e709892633f356bb20c25c02f3 (08:13): soyben, So you have this server. What port is it supposed to run on?
cce377a031c971106434fc9e704d362e (08:13): anyhow i found another way to use that port
cce377a031c971106434fc9e704d362e (08:14): thanks though for the inputs
